title.narrative: Emergency response in flood affected 3 states of Nigeria (CARE)

description.narrative: 1. Identification and registeration of affected and most vulnerable families e.g female headed households, child headed households, elderly, PLWDs, widows and families with under-nutrition children. 2. Develop close liasion and coordination with NEMA at national and with SEMA at state level. 3. Designing and undertaking market assessments for ensuring functionality and assessability of the markets by beneficiaries. 4. Setting up beneficiaries' feedback and complaints response mechanism for accountable and transparent project delivery. 5. Contracting with cellular service provider for disbursing unconditional cash in a safe and transparent manner. 6. Developing database of beneficiaries for smooth and seamless distribution planning. 7. Disbursement of cash to indentified and registered families in target LGAs and communities of most affected states. 8. GBV and protection issues sensitation and awareness campaign among beneficiaries 9. Post distribution monitoring for assessing the effectiveness of extended cash assistance. 10. Monitoring of project activities and supervision of project teams

Disaster affected and vulnerable people receive in-kind/cash assistance for food, NFIs, WASH items that suit them best to meet their basic needs in a timely and dignified manner as per humanitarian principles and imperative. Children under 5 years of age are protected against the risk of getting under-nourishment and Internally displaced females will have access to clean and hygiene sanitation material.
